meanings.definition: To separate something that is grouped together.
meanings.sent1: I will ungroup the toys to organize them better.
meanings.sent2: It is easier to ungroup the colors before starting the art project.
meanings.sent3: The magician tried to ungroup the cards, but they kept sticking together!
meanings.sent4: Her laughter seemed to ungroup the tension in the room.
meanings.sent5: The sun's rays gently ungrouped the clouds, revealing a clear blue sky.

meanings.sent1: Please ungroup the red blocks from the stack.
meanings.sent2: She had to ungroup the incorrect items from the list.
meanings.sent3: The chef had to ungroup the burnt cookies from the fresh batch.
meanings.sent4: His absence seemed to ungroup the harmony of the team.
meanings.sent5: The wind's force threatened to ungroup the leaves from the tree branches.
